explanation: Agent A is correct. The condition in the value-loop contains the same (';' == l) alternative twice; the second occurrence is redundant. Because the duplicate comparison has no side-effects and its removal cannot change the evaluated boolean result (nor program behaviour), it is an operation that may be executed yet whose removal would not affect behaviour, which fits MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2’s definition of dead code. Removing the duplicated alternative (or otherwise eliminating the redundancy) is the appropriate fix.
